title.narrative: Reinforcing the Church’s commitment in Africa, phase 5

description.narrative: Reinforcing the Church’s commitment in Africa to enhance social justice, good governance, environmental protection with a view to achieve integral human development. This project seeks to contribute to an integrated, prosperous and peaceful Africa. The intermediate results towards this goal are: - Improve advocacy engagement with AU - Strengthen the project’s research profile to support evidenced-based advocacy - Intensify engagement with partners, especially Regional Conferences on lobby and advocacy actions - Take concrete steps together with key actors towards the protection of the Congo Basin and mitigating the impact of climate change in the region - Deepen the knowledge of Church-based actors on environmental challenges and carry out exemplary lobbying activities – if necessary in cooperation with other civil society actors - Work together with civil society, government and international community through coordinated campaigns to discourage illegal migration and human trafficking in Africa - Intensify the promotion of church leaders’ support to communities affected by land and resource grabbing (collaborative partnerships with CIDSE, “Our land is our life” platform, and Vatican Ecology Commission and Covid-19 Task Force) - The long-term result is to reach out to the vulnerable and those at the periphery
